SENIOR INTERIOR DESIGNER

SUMMARY

Experienced   Interior Designer with a  diverse knowledge base of design styles and techniques after living and working in different parts of the world.
Proven skills in sales and project management.
Successful at listening to the needs of the client and collaborating on a creative vision.
Drafting in CAD,  produce 3D renderings and monitor installations is part of my every day job.
A team player who is an expert at m ultitasking and work under pressure to meet deadlines.
Open for a position in the field of Interior Architecture and Design.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. Product Development Engineer

Location: Grand Rapids, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Overview

The Senior Engineer – Product Development leads the development on products for new and existing floorcare product lines. In this key role, he/she will lead the PD&E activities to ensure that BISSELL requirements are met with a result of successful product launches. This person will have a heavy emphasis in technical expertise while having the ability to create and manage a project schedule, maintain and strengthen supplier relationships, and be a critical link in technical communications both within BISSELL and with outside suppliers.

Responsibilities

Direction and overall responsibility for technical aspects of the product and project.Design plastic parts for injection molding.Integration of electronic and electromechanical componentsSpecify and select purchased components.Development of comprehensive test plans.Set clear and thorough part, material, and overall product specifications.Technical definition of product and feasibility studiesAnalysis of test results and the understanding of performance.Coaching, mentoring and possible supervision of junior engineers, designers, and co-ops.Provide technical information about the project to others in the company.Recommend and participate in the improvement of methods, equipment, staffing.Responsible for completeness, correctness and accuracy of CAD dataEstimate technical project resources requirements and project expensesMay be required to perform other duties as assigned

Environment

Interaction with global engineering teams, Industrial Design, CAD, Marketing, Consumer Experience, Buyers, Operations, Test Lab, etcFast paced, fact-based decision makingConcept to production involvement in projectsLimited travel

Qualifications

REQUIRED CORE COMPETENCIES

Functional/Technical ExpertiseGlobal Business AcumenSelf-ManagementLearning VersatilityDelivers ResultsJudgment and Decision MakingManagerial CourageContinuous Improvement

Required Experience/Education

Degree minimum: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering

Specific Concentration

Mechanical engineeringStrength in engineering fundamentals Analytical approach to problemsAbility to understand voice of consumer needs and integrate these into product specsBasic personal computer skillsElectromechanical consumer productsUL approved productsTest development and results analysisProject scheduling and trackingPlastic part designTeam environment

Experience level:  5+ years of experience in product development

Specialized Training/Education Preferred

3D CAD and geometric dimensioningExposure to finite element analysis (FEA), computational fluid dynamics (CFD)Fluid or air moving productsDesign for Assembly Analysis (DFA)Failure Modes and Effect Analysis (FMEA, DFMEA)Project managementDesign of Experiments (DoE, Taguchi)Reading and comprehension of utility patentsSupervisory experience

Skills Required

Strength in engineering fundamentals Analytical approach to problemsBasic personal computer skillsElectromechanical consumer productsUL approved productsTest development and results analysisProject scheduling and trackingPlastic part design

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
